relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
check accreditation and tuition. saint leo university is a great value with a great reputation.

saint leo has a great reputation and the classes are rigorous and challenging. the counselors and instructors are very helpful and supportive. the best part is that it is a non-profit school so they are more concerned about the quality of my education than making a profit.
pageTitle: Saint Leo University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {355990=I have enrolled and I begin classes on April 29, 2013. The advisors have been awesome and have really answered all my questions about everything. They have made this whole process very easy., 355463=Have not yet began. I will begin on April 29th., 490375=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 207464=I have been enrolled at Saint Leo (Adult Center, Georgia) since March 2012 and can't express how much I've appreciated the professionalism of the instructors. As a non-traditional student I was apprehensive about returning to school. I haven't regretted my decision!, 89042=campus was founded in 1889., 149561=Staff has been very helpful in transitioning from my community college. Financial aid representative is easy to work with and informative. Look forward to starting my first semester Fall 2012., 147549=I will be attending Saint Leo in the fall of 2012 as a freshman., 412024=As a commuter, a meal plan is not required. That being said, I have gone into the main dining area a few times. The food is great; it is buffet style. The only draw back for commuters and the main dining area is the price, $10 as of 2013. The Lion's Lair is more reasonable on price but it is not a buffet and there are limited options. However, it offers grilled items, deli items, snacks, drinks, and items needed for your dorm if you live on campus.}

Bang for the buck THE TUTION IS EXPENSIVE BUT THE EDUCATION IS DEFINATELY WORTH IT Am enjoying being here I LOVE THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE STUDENTS ARE REALLY NICE.
